oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hallmarks of Country Music - George Jones
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of an interview of George Jones (musician). The interview is hosted by Rick Phillips (army sergeant/ radio host) for the Hallmarks of Country Music segment. The tape was recorded on an unidentified date.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: George Jones; Rick Phillips
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) George Jones commercial spot for the Hallmarks of Country Music program -- (00:11) Hallmarks tune [featuring Phillips introduction voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (00:51) Drug rehabilitation USO commercial radio spot -- (01:22) Tender Years (George Jones) -- (03:40) Rick Phillips introduces Jones; additionally, both discuss how Jones originally painted upon returning from the Korean War -- (05:19) Phillips inquires as to how Jones managed to sign with Star Day Records -- (06:04) Take Me (George Jones) -- (08:36) Phillips addresses the military about air-mail opportunities -- (09:30) Planned Parenthood commercial spot hosted by an unidentified voice -- (10:00) Phillips introduces "The Race is On" -- (10:09) The Race is On (George Jones) -- (12:13) Phillips asks Jones to reflect on the 'country standard,' "White Lightning" -- (15:53) A Girl I Used to Know (George Jones) -- (18:30) Rick Phillips performs a military commercial about schooling -- (18:47) An unidentified host performs a Tom T. Hall commercial spot for the military -- (19:28) Your Heart Turned Left (George Jones) -- (20:38) Phillips and Jones discuss the importance of versatility and country's changing nature -- (24:20)Phillips asks where Jones discovered "She Thinks I Still Care" -- (25:12) She Thinks I Still Care (George Jones) -- (27:40) Phillips military commercial spot about Superior Performance Pay -- (28:19) Window Up Above (George Jones) -- (29:47) Jones reflects on his favorite songs that had recorded; additionally, Phillips inquires about the large organization Jones keeps on his road tours -- (33:07) A Picture of Me Without You (George Jones) -- (35:40) Anti-smoking commercial spot hosted by an unidentified voice -- (36:10) Telephone Call (George Jones and Tina Jones) -- (38:22) Jones praises Tina Jones, and both Jones and Phillips discuss Jones' children moving to Nashville -- (42:43) We're Not the Jet Set (George Jones) -- (44:16) Phillips performs a military reunion commercial spot -- (44:37) Once You've Had the Best (George Jones) -- (47:14) Presidents Council on Physical Fitness and Spots radio spot hosted by Johnny Cash -- (47:44) Four-O-Thirty-Three (George Jones) -- (50:04) Phillips asks Jones to reflect on the direction country music is headed -- (51:37) Grand Tour (George Jones) -- (53:26) Hallmarks outro tune [featuring Phillips outro voiceover] ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Insert is of program information. The insert features time stamps.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Phillips, Rick; Jones, George; Jones, George, 1931-2013;
